result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Rebecca L Kilps

records.addlTxt: Further proceedings on November 4, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Order Modifying Bond.
It is ordered that the defendant's bond be amended to read: the defendant is to have no unsupervised contact with anyone under the age of 18, with the exception of her son, W.E.K., DOB: 06-02-2019.  It is ordered that all other terms and conditions of the defendant's bond remain unchanged.

11:48 AM Defendant Rebecca L Kilps appeared by video.  Attorney Jeffrey P Kippa appeared by video for Rebecca L Kilps.  Attorney Angelina R Scarpelli appeared by video for State of Wisconsin. 
Defense has filed a motion to modify bail to allow no unsupervised contact with anyone under the age of 18. State objects to the modification and asks the court to deny it. Court comments and grants the defendant's motion and will sign the proposed order that was previously submitted. Defendant is to report to the Clerk of Court's Office to sign an amended bond.
Defendant's Motion to Modify Bond.
Motion hearing on September 8, 2022 at 11:45 am.

11:04 a.m.  Inducement of 8/9/22.  Defendant waives her right to a preliminary hearing.  Defendant is bound over to Circuit Court Branch 3 for trial.
ARRAIGNMENT - 
Information filed. Copy served on defense counsel.
Not guilty plea(s) entered.  Jury calendar.
Offer deadline:  9/30/22, 8:30 a.m.
Further proceedings scheduled for September 30, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Order to Modify Bond.
It is hereby ordered that the defendant's bond be amended to allow her to travel to Illinois on 07-24-22 to visit her brother, she will be with accompanied by her parents for this day trip.  All other conditions not modified by this order remain in full force and effect.
Letter to the Court to Withdraw Motion

9:39 a.m.  All parties appear in person.  The defendant's motion to compel release of victim impact statement has been stipulated to; the State will release a photocopy of the VIS to Atty. Kippa.  The VIS is to remain sealed to the public.  Atty. Kippa will send in a follow-up letter confirming receipt of document and withdrawal of motion.  New preliminary hearing requested by counsel for further negotiations.  Time limits have been previously waived.  Preliminary hearing rescheduled to 8/25/22 at 11:00 a.m., Br. 3.   Zoom if waiver; in person if contested.  Atty. Kippa motions the court for bond modification.  Bond prohibits out of state travel; defendant wants to visit brother this weekend.  No objection by the State as long as there are no children involved and defendant is traveling with parents.  Court grants request.  Atty. Kippa shall draft the order.  Adj. 9:43 a.m.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for August 25, 2022 at 11:00 am.
Preliminary hearing on August 25, 2022 at 11:00 am.
Defendant's Motion to Compel Release of Victim Impact Statement
Request and Response Regarding Open Records - emailed 06-09-2022

1:55 pm - Prosecuting attorney Anthony A. Lambrecht in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Rebecca L Kilps in court.  Attorney Jeffrey P Kippa in court for Rebecca L Kilps. Defendant demands a preliminary hearing.  Defendant waives the statutory time period within which a preliminary hearing must be held. Preliminary hearing is set for 07-22-22 at 9:00 a.m.
BAIL MOTION:
Defendant is requesting modification of the condition of bail so she may have contact with her 3 year old son.  The State will leave this up to the court discretion.  The Court modifies the condition of bail to allow the defendant to have contact with her own son, W.E.K., DOB: 06-02-2019.  Attorney Kippa to prepare the necessary order.
Defendant's passport surrendered to Clerk of Court office and is being held in the safe until disposition of case.

Order to Modify Bond
It is hereby ordered that the defendant's bond be amended to read: "The defendant is to have no contact with anyone under the age of 18, with the exception of her son, W.E.K., DOB: 06-02-2019."   It is hereby ordered that all other terms and conditions of the defendant's bond remain unchanged.
Preliminary hearing on July 22, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Order to Seal Victim Impact Statement.

IRS Form 8300
Original mailed to IRS
Copy given or mailed to poster and defendant
Order to report to TRPD for photo and prints

$10,000.00 cash bail furnished and defendant is released from custody.   
Notice to Party Furnishing Cash Bail Bond. 
--Edmond James Thompson, 6714 North Avenue, Cleveland, WI  53015.

BAIL HEARING - 
Defendant in custody and appearing by video from the Manitowoc County Jail.  The State informs the Court that the defendant will be charged with the crime of sexual assault of a student by a school instructional staff person.  The matter is continued for initial appearance on 05-31-22 at 2:30 p.m.  Bail is set at $10,000.00 cash bond with the conditions that he report to the Two Rivers Police Department for fingerprints, photographs and identifying information within 48 hours or, if incarcerated, within 72 hours of release, defendant is to have no contact with anyone under the age of 18.  Defendant must have no contact with the victim, Z.M.F., DOB: 05-20-04.  Defendant must have no contact with any buildings or staff of the Two Rivers School District except for administration as necessary regarding her employment.  Defendant must not travel outside the State of Wisconsin unless approved by the Court.  Defendant must surrender her passport.   Bail furnished and defendant is released from custody.
Minutes.

Order to Seal Probable Cause Statement.
The original document was titled: Probable cause statement /judicial determination
The original history event date is: 05-25-2022
